title: Why I won't be receiving my gold ranked rewards this season:
body:

I'm a little confused because you are posting logs from one of the games from your penalty about a year ago when you have a recent one from a few weeks ago.

Is this the game that is showing up in your reform card?

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=EhHV3MTu,comment-id=0011,timestamp=2018-11-01T20:13:02.143+0000)

And since they stack it still is just as important.

The others I can't really argue about.
I mean I could, but the snowflakes might cry ^^^^^^^^

One of the others was me SLIGHTLY going off on a guy who said he was going to AFK in fountain in my ranked game after feeding if we didn't forfeit.

Whats worse? Someone telling some asshole off or some guy RUINING the game?

This system is all backasswards.

Edit: I haven't been chat banned since like April though, so I don't have a current reform card.  ^^

> Because this is the most ridiculous one.
And since they stack it still is just as important.

Then why aren't you posting the other game given during that penalty as well? When a player is penalized the system attempts to give them evidence that may help them reform. You can't look at a single piece of evidence and ignore the others.

I think the more important question is ... why does Riot believe it is their job to parent the community?  I have been gaming for many years (I am older than most of your employees) - Riot is the first company I have ever seen act as Thought/Communication Police/Parents. (especially with an automated system that detects chat)

People are pretty well set in their ways by the time they can legally log into your game without parental consent.  You are not changing anyone, nor will you.  Moreover, Riot is not even effectively weeding out toxic players.

As someone who works in business finance... I can state what you already know to be true.  Riot is not trying to "help" people become less toxic.  It has found an excuse to ban accounts, causing it's business portfolio to look better.

1. More new users to report.  The game is growing!
2. New skin revenue due to lost accounts.  

If Riot truly wanted to weed out toxicity - it would use hardware bans.

> 2. New skin revenue due to lost accounts.  
>

I was with you until you presented the idea that they do it for their business portfolio. While I doubt that, I do think its disgusting to police social interactions to the extent that they do. 

I just think they do it because a lot of people complain about toxicity, so they thought it would be better to do something about it, rather than keep losing players due to it. Unfortunately, its spiraled from the tribunal, to what we have today. And then they get TONS of players who support it, so they keep it going, thinking its the right thing to do for their business. 

Less players quitting the game because they get flamed all the time and cant do anything about it (something i can understand, but really dont care about), and possibly new accounts being made by players who were permabanned, and may even buy shit again for their new accounts. Its like an added bonus lol. Of course money is the bottom line for a company, but i doubt it is as malicious as you suggest.

> and possibly new accounts being made by players who were permabanned, and may even buy shit again for their new accounts. Its like an added bonus lol.

This is exactly what I just said ... they have incentive to ban players because it makes their business portfolio look better.

#1 It appears the game is growing due to new accounts being created.
#2 People buy new shit for their new account after they lose old account to a ban.

That is literally what I just said lol.

> #2 People buy new shit for their new account after they lose old account to a ban.

I don't personally know anyone who would be willing to buy things from a company they truly feel wronged by. For example, if I felt my regular grocery store was saying they price matched goods, and didn't follow through, I would not continue to patron that particular store.

If I were banned in a game, and I felt the ban was unjustified, why in the blue hell would I want to buy anything and support a company that I felt is in the wrong?

The same reason people go back to a drug dealer that stiffed them.  They are addicted to the product.  There is more than ample research out there showing the addiction pathways of video games.  Scientifically proven by hooking individuals up to machines and watching their dopamine spike.

https://www.psychologytoday.com/us/blog/the-compass-pleasure/201110/video-games-can-activate-the-brains-pleasure-circuits-0

https://www.livescience.com/17033-gamer-brain-reward-system.html

https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3039876/

> [{quoted}](name=Veigàr,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=EhHV3MTu,comment-id=00110005000100010000000000000000,timestamp=2018-11-15T04:44:05.492+0000)

> The same reason people go back to a drug dealer that stiffed them.  They are addicted to the product.  There is more than ample research out there showing the addiction pathways of video games.  Scientifically proven by hooking individuals up to machines and watching their dopamine spike.

> 
> https://www.livescience.com/17033-gamer-brain-reward-system.html
> 
> https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3039876/

Basically, **any** type of reward system can become an addiction (food, sex, pain, etc). I would like to see the research that shows buying in-game items causes that same effect. I understand the gambling addiction from chests, but outright buying them? Coming back to a game for the risk/reward of losing/winning, but purchasing products? What does one get out of buying skins?

There may be some people out there that have shopping addictions AND play LoL, but I would bet the intersection of those two populations is pretty small.

tl;dr
New account, continue playing: makes sense
Buying shit for new account: makes no sense

My gut feeling is obviously that the reasoning is flawed, but it's hard to pinpoint exactly why in a rational argument... Maybe you might help?

I can't really see this as a ridicillious one. But I'll elaborate from what anyone here can easily make out of this.

1 - Halfway your chatlog, you're immediately already in the 'giving up' mood. I don't think I need to point at the examples what "negative attitude" mentions.
2 - Being on the defense does not warrant you yourself going retaliation-mode. You keep insinuating you're on the Defensive side, but you are constantly talking low of other people yourself too. The best and only proper form of defense, is simpy _muting_ them.
3 - You're putting way, way too much energy into chat. League of Legends is a MOBA, not a keyboard-warrior game.

No matter if a player is bad, you never, ever go fight with them (even if they initiated it first). At any and all times you have the option to choose the adult way out of this, by just ignoring them and carrying on. If you're stuck in your elo because you keep experiencing this, you might want to reconsider why that is. And trust me, it's not because your team is bad. It's because, as key example from above, you let your whole team get distracted over something that never needed attention in first place.
